At the Episcopal Church of St. Stephen the Martyr in Edina, Minn., Marissa Harris Miller, a daughter of William R. Miller of New York and Lawrence, L.I., and the late Nancy McClain Harris Miller of Paris, Ill., was married yesterday to James William Howard, a son of Mr. and Mrs. William T. Howard of Gill, Colo. The Rev. David B. Joslin performed the ceremony.
Sarah Rogers Miller was her sister's maid of honor. John Swirchak was the best man.

Mrs. Howard, who is known as Ris, is employed in customer services at the Metro Printing Company in Eden Prairie, Minn. She graduated from the Rye Country Day School and Denison University. The bride made her debut at the St. Nicholas Society Ball in 1976. She is a descendant of William Bradford, a governor of Plymouth Colony, and Stephen Hopkins, a signer of the Mayflower Compact. The bride's father is the president of Brown, Harris, Stevens Inc., a real-estate concern in Manhattan.

Mr. Howard, the production director at Kerker Associates, an advertising agency in Minneapolis, graduated from the University of Colorado at Boulder and served with the Air Force in Vietnam. He has been married and divorced. His father is a rancher in Gill.
